intro: Matelea texensis, commonly known as Texas matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color, often with contrasting white or yellow markings. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Matelea texensis is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
